Current Colors

Colors

Description

A list of the approved colors to be used for Funding Circle projects. We use basic color names as key names (purple, green, blue, etc.) with various shades as array elements. Retrieve the value by using:

get-color(purple, light)
// the 2nd parameter defines the shade of the color - it is an optional parameter, as the default shade is the base shade

Usage example

black

  1. get-color(black)

blue

  1. get-color(blue, lighter)
  2. get-color(blue, light)
  3. get-color(blue, base)
  4. get-color(blue, dark)
  5. get-color(blue, darker)

green

  1. get-color(green, lighter)
  2. get-color(green, light)
  3. get-color(green, base)
  4. get-color(green, dark)
  5. get-color(green, darker)

grey cool

  1. get-color(grey-cool, light)
  2. get-color(grey-cool, base)
  3. get-color(grey-cool, dark)
  4. get-color(grey-cool, darker)

grey warm

  1. get-color(grey-warm, lighter)
  2. get-color(grey-warm, light)
  3. get-color(grey-warm, base)
  4. get-color(grey-warm, dark)
  5. get-color(grey-warm, darker)
  6. get-color(grey-warm, darkest)

magenta

  1. get-color(magenta, lighter)
  2. get-color(magenta, light)
  3. get-color(magenta, base)
  4. get-color(magenta, dark)
  5. get-color(magenta, darker)

orange red

  1. get-color(orange-red, lighter)
  2. get-color(orange-red, light)
  3. get-color(orange-red, base)
  4. get-color(orange-red, dark)
  5. get-color(orange-red, darker)

purple

  1. get-color(purple, lighter)
  2. get-color(purple, light)
  3. get-color(purple, base)
  4. get-color(purple, dark)
  5. get-color(purple, darker)

red

  1. get-color(red)

turquoise

  1. get-color(turquoise, lighter)
  2. get-color(turquoise, light)
  3. get-color(turquoise, base)
  4. get-color(turquoise, dark)
  5. get-color(turquoise, darker)

yellow

  1. get-color(yellow, lighter)
  2. get-color(yellow, light)
  3. get-color(yellow, base)
  4. get-color(yellow, dark)
  5. get-color(yellow, darker)

white

  1. get-color(white)
